review: Today was my 21st birthday, and we sat at the bar. Connor was our server, and he was a great one! Drinks were strong and his service was friendly. Will be returning. Thanks Connor!!!!
Chilis corporate should go take a look at this place.  It is disgusting and way  slow standard.  Food was awful.  Bathrooms were overflowing.  Gross!!

Good service. Nice wait staff. Never have to wait long to be sat or for food to arrive. Love the Plenti tracking point system with bonus discounts or deals. ~ ~ ~ TIP: if they are busy, sit in the bar area..it's just as comfortable and the music is not too loud.

Mmmmmmmm don't have really much to say about this place my ratings say it all. Food is bland, ingredients do not taste real lacking flavor And authenticity. Would not recommend this place at all. Service was decent that's about it

My boyfriend and I come here time to time for dinner and mainly get items from their 2 for $20 menu. It's all tasty.  I've always disliked the condition the seats, booths and tables are in. Last time I was here the table was not wiped from previous diners and whatever they left got on my hands and menu. The menu sort of wreaked too. The booths are old and ripped  and the seats feel lumpy. Not comfy.  Service is always good. Very attentive. I don't think we'll be back too often just because I couldn't get too comfy because of cleanliness.
Management & our waitress were amazingly nice and I loved them. Their chef, however, SUCKS. Are you trying to kill me with this steak?

Well, well, well guess who"s back at Chilly's, yep it's me again and quess what the customer service right away a excellent from Reanna. Why do I say that? I'll tell you why,  From the moment I sat down in the bar area she acknowledge me and let me know she'll be right with me so I was just waiting wondering where and when so I'm going to come and take my order for my meal. ReAnna was attentive, kind and came back more the once to check on if I everthing was ok or If I needed anything else. She showed and explained to me the fancy high tech menu thing on the table. Point is even though the was kinda full,, she did not forget about me. This time I order the Triple Dipper and the White Spinish Queso, both I would recommend. Ask for ReAnna!

My wife and I will never be returning to this Chili's location. Andrew the  "Manager" has a horrible disposition and the service is just as bad.  We visited this location today 12/21/16 for dinner. We were excited to try the new smokehouse items they have available. It took 15 minutes to actually get our order in because our server just didn't return to take our order and to add insult to injury people that were sat well after we were, not only got their food, they seemed to get much better service than we were receiving.  When we finally got our food, it was though it had been sitting for quite sometime and was at best luke warm. It took another 10 minutes for the server to return so that we could have some fresh food brought out. She took our fries and never returned. I had to get up and request a manager to come speak with us. Insert Andrew the rude manager! He approached the table with an attitude and spoke to us with such a condescending tone, and asked if wanted to box our food up that was cold and not very good. Why would we want to take anything home? Andrew was extremely rude and borderline disrespectful telling us "we could just get up and go now" and blaming the horrible service on the holidays (the restaurant wasn't very busy at all). This is not how you handle a customer complaint and problem. They need to retrain these servers and managers immediately!

I read their story of how Chilis got started and sigh with the disappointment of what corporate America and greed can do to ruin what once was a dream.  That said, my last experience was decent, which has been the complete opposite of all my previous experiences.  This time, we had an attentive server that kept the (not complimentary) drink and chips and salsa coming, though I really hate their "Pace Picante" like salsa.  Our food was good, which has in previous been the low points of the meal.  Wife's tacos were really messy but good.  My kids quesadilla and mini burger were generic, and my baby back platter was above average.  I really liked their roasted corn.  I had some Be My Guest cards, which is the only reason why I came back.  But this time it was not too shabby!
The chilis on fall brook very fast on bringing the food and so attentive. They  come to check on you to see if you need to order.

Been here many times, the food is always good, never a problem but a recurring theme is the disaster of the men's room and I keep hoping for a change but there never is. Tonight I finally said something. I was taking my two daughters to bathroom and, surprising... not an ounce of toilet paper on either roll, no toilet liners either. Apparently all of the tp was on the ground and the garbage can was spilling onto the floor. I can't show all of the disgusting 'stuff' but I'm attaching pix of it toned down.  The frustration was that I told the workers before we sat down to eat, because the kids had to go first. They said it would be taken care of. About an hour later, they had to go again. The floor was cleaned-up but still... no toilet paper or liners!  Come on management, this is unacceptable and, without fail, it's ALWAYS the same situation EVERY time I come here. Send someone in every 30 minutes to check.

Chili's is not somewhere I go expecting amazing food and service. I usually get take out at every location because it's the safest and quickest way to go. I'm usually a TGI fridays person, but hadn't been to chili's in a few years. Doordash to the rescue.  So...game 5 of the NBA finals, wanted food but wanted to be in my living room. I went with the triple dipper appetizer and 1/2 rack of craft beer ribs. A lot has changed on the menu (WHY did they get rid of the chicken with the bacon, cheese, and green onions?! It was amazing), but the ribs were great. I chose corn and loaded mashed potatoes and as usual, no disappointments there. As for the triple dipper, I chose big mouth bites, boneless honey-chipotle wings, and crispy cheddar bites. The first two were good, with the boneless wings being the best and I wish i would have just gotten those and the sliders. The crispy cheddar bites are disgusting and not crispy. Nor were they hot.  All in all, ill come here every once in a blue moon still, but not something to rave about since they have gone pretty much strictly tex-mex and low calorie for their menu.

Worst Chili's ever! Total meltdown. Sunday night 7:30. Dirty uncleared tables all around. Kitchen looked like a tornado went through, wet floors, trash, food on floor, looked gross. The wait for the food was totally unacceptable! We almost walked out! Restrooms were discusting, trash can overflowing, paper toweles in urinal, just filthy. This Chili's was totally overwhelmed, mismanaged and understaffed. The servers were working hard trying to keep up. Never saw busboys. Servers were trying to clear tables. Felt sorry for the employees. The owners should really take a look at this Chili's! We won't be back! Now we are scared to eat at any Chili's!

My wife and I  came for dinner with our two young granddaughters. I had gotten an email with a coupon that kids eat free with an adult entree. My wife and I really enjoy Chili's fajitas. So we got dinner for two for twenty bucks. We each got the chicken fajitas. My granddaughter's each had a child's meal at no charge. All in all, dinner for 4 for twenty bucks. Now that's a great deal. Ambience: typical Chili's restaurant. The booths are large. The restaurant is clean. Lots of TVs throughout the restaurant. In addition, each table has an iPad type device that allows you to view the menu and pay your bill. But more importantly when you're there with young children, there are video games that are appropriate for fairly young children to play for a nominal fee ( unlimited games for $2). A big hit with my granddaughters. Service: the service tonight was exceptional. Our server, Jacqueline, was to our table within minutes of our seating. She brought our drinks promptly. The service was well-paced. In addition, we had a minor problem. The manager, Jen , came over and handled it in an extremely professional way leaving us very happy. Food: The 2 for $20 comes with an appetizer to share .  We chose  the  guacamole and chips .  A huge portion  of chips with a very generous portion of guacamole and an equally generous portion of salsa. Way more than anyone should eat as an appetizer.  And the guac was delicious. The fajitas consist of a fairly generous portion of grilled chicken, grilled green peppers, and side dish with guacamole, sour cream, cheese, salsa, and chopped tomatoes. Really tasty and portion size large enough to bring home for tomorrow's lunch. Value: when four people can enjoy a dinner for $20 plus have leftovers for the next day, that's a great value. I will be coming back again.

My neighborhood Chilli's! It's a pretty solid restaurant, with a lot of options. Great place for families. Food is pretty good, and the customer service is always amazing. To-go food is also very efficient, although very time consuming. They say the food will be ready in 15 minutes but really it's 30 minutes! The best thing about this restaurant is their chocolate molten lava cake. It's probably the best dessert known to man. Hard chocolate coating over a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top of hot fudge brownie. Does not get any better than that! A couple of my favorite entrees here are: Baby back (BBQ) ribs, fajita trio (Steak, shrimp, chicken), shrimp Cajun pasta, and the original battered chicken crispers with a side of loaded mash with all of those items. Not to mention their mango ice tea is really really good!

I remember years ago Chilis was the place to go when i wanted to have a special mother/daughter bonding time prior to us going wheat and gluten free. Last night we decided to go with the whole family and it was nothing like I remembered. We asked the server if they have gluten free menu and he gave us this list of which dish has no wheat in it, very slim picking. So we ordered GRILLED chicken for our son, steak for our daughter, salad for me and fajitas for hubby. The kids food came first which was great except they gave my son this deep fried chicken with tons of batter on it. Told the server (AGAIN) we have wheat allergies and we ordered grilled. He took it back and we had to wait another 10 mins. My salad came along with the grilled chicken which is so microscopic that my son asked for dinner after he ate his dinner! Mind you my son is a light eater and it didnt even fill him up. Once everyone was done with their meal, hubby's fajita finally came with FLOUR tortillas. No regards to allergy at all here. His $17 fajitas also had tiny portions. He was only able to eat half of it as we were all still starving so we were picking at his plate. All in all it was a true disappointment to come here and waste all that money for HORRENDOUS service, baby portions and zero regards to people's allergies. The whole family agreed that we will NOT be coming back....sad!!

Standard Chili's with a few issues. They served me beef fajitas that were partially raw and bloody. Instead of replacing the dish they made me scrape the beef onto a side plate, then they brought it back and left me to dump it back on my skillet. Oh yeah, they charge extra if you want beans or rice with your fajitas. That's a weak move.  Server was nice and we were seated quickly.
The service really, really sucks at this place. The restaurant is pretty much all empty in a Tuesday evening. But nobody came around to take our orders. I would never come to this place again.
I love chilies, the burger is delicious and the service is great. I come here with my friends and family and we always have a great time

Went there on a Monday evening around 7. The place was pretty empty, except for the bar area. Took a while for the hostess to show up and seat us. Took another 15 minutes for someone to acknowledge we were there. There were only 4 tables with patrons, but no servers to be found. We had actually thought about getting up and leaving, when a server finally showed up. He indicated that he had very needy customers and that was why it took him so long. The server was pleasant and the food was okay. But, service took a long time and refills were scarce. Don't know what has happened to this location, but probably explains why it was so empty. Hope they improve.

---INFO, VIBE & SERVICE--- Your usual reasonable chain restaurant. The bar is usually a happening spot, and of course the dining area side will depend on times and days. Of course it's a casual place with a similar look and feel to other locations....so there's that.  I've had good service the times I've been with a nice greet at the door, and nice servers/bartenders. To help with service they use the tabletop ordering tablets for ordering, paying bills, and more. So that helps with somethings.  Lots of parking around available in the lot.  ---FOOD & PRICES--- I've been coming for some years every now and then, and I can't really say I've had bad times or bad food.  I'm a sucker for the Triple Dipper. Three appetizers featured with some dipping sauces.  Somethings I like: Boneless wings and bone in wings Southwestern eggrolls - crispy flour tortillas filled with chicken, black beans, corn, cheese, red pepper, and spinach.  Nachos - These are individual pieces of tortillas with the ingredients on each one (chicken, cheeese, beans, jalapenos, queso) Texas cheese fries - How can you not like cheese fries?! Skillet queso Big mouth bites I usually mess around with appetizers when I come and some drinks so I can't say much about the entree's.

This is going to be a weird review.  We didn't have to wait for a table, we were seated right away. Our waiter was super nice and helpful, only thing was it felt like he was rushing with us... My dad was in the restroom and my mom did state we wanted to wait for him but still the waiter just stood there to ask us for our order.  After taking our order he just stood there because we only order 3 huge plates (we were a party of 5) and made it seem like it was weird to share food.  When our food arrived, I forgot to ask for ranch. I waited for the waiter to come back and ask "if everything is alright"...the waiter never came! Not all the way till we were done and paid our check through the iPad...  Overall food is very very bland, very small portions. The table could have been cleaner and the seats as well.

Hello Chili's corporate...anyone home? This location is totally off track and over-rated at anything above a 1 star. Wow. Where do I begin.   Ordered a selection of appies including the onion rings, fried pickles and buffalo chicken strips. All were sent back for being over cooked and almost burnt. The replacement were mostly an insult. The chicken strips came back uncooked and drowning in sauce.  I guess they are pre-cooked are sitting by waiting for an order and only then dropped into the frier....resulting in dry and rock hard chunks of chard chicken. The onion rings came back still dry to the core but at least we're not dark coffee brown as in the first go around The pickles better but MOSTLY BATTER PIECES leaving you to dig for the actual pickles in the oily mess. Come to main dish items was not much better.    Service was a little better than the food....but only slightly. Shame.  We used to love Chili's Goodbye

Decided to go here since I hadn't been to a Chili's in years.  Sat at the bar and ordered drinks, apps and a burger.  Everything I ordered was really tasty... especially the burger.  Service was good and price was fair... will definitely be back.

Solid Chili's location. Service is usually fast and friendly. The bar area is good for grabbing a quick bite. We also use their to go quite a bit, and our orders are always accurate. My husband enjoys their burgers, and I always get one with a black bean patty substitute. My one recommendation is that Chili's would include more vegetarian choices overall on their menu.

Ok, Chilis don't make me have to downgrade your stars!   We checked in last week on a Tuesday night.   Your Resturaunt was dead at 6pm.  Service was ok but the place was dirty!   You need to clean your restrooms and the hallway leading to them seemed dirty as well.  It looks like your floors need to be scrubbed, steam cleaned, and bleached!   It is grimy all over the floors.   For a time that you weren't busy, your restrooms should not be overflowing with trash and have no paper towels for wiping hands.   Come on, don't make your regulars avoid coming back.  We like the food and we're happy otherwise but the restrooms are a turn off! PS, no I didn't complain in person!  Frankly, I didn't want to escalate the issue because I didn't want to further ruin my dining experience.  It would have just completely erased my appetite if I had to explain the obvious to management.  Get it together!!!

Not sure why this location has such a bad rep. It has a huge parking lot that you can pick and choose to your liking. That is a huge perk in LA. As soon as you walk in the host greets you with a huge smile. That is a huge plus for me.  The waiter came right away and took our appetizer order and drinks. Hubby and I ordered the smothered fries. Sad to say we practically licked the plate lol. They were so good!  For our entrees we ordered the blackened salmon and the shrimp fajitas. Food was hot and delicious just as we would expect from this franchise. For dessert we had the salted caramel molten cake. It was to die for! We did not even have to wait for the waiter to ask us because we ordered it right at the table. Love that! The waiter was really nice and kept giving us refills for our drinks. It was great. Had no complaints therefore they get a five star review that simple! :)

Table was sticky, informed waiter and  still sticky after they tried cleaning.  Hamburgers tasted like they re-heated them. Kids pizza tasted horrible.  Use to be a big fan of Chili's but the last two times we have gone it's bad.  We tried the Woodland hills because a few weeks ago we ate at the Encino location and the food was ok but the restrooms were dirty and the floors  in the eating area were also bad.  Wonder if their Management has changed.  Either way will no return.................

I am not a big reviewer but STAY AWAY WHEN THEYRE BUSY!! Our server was great but definitely over worked. I ordered ribs that were ice cold, to the point were the sauce was paste like. To make matters worse I got FOOD POISONING from that meal!! Horrible experience, we used to frequent them often but NOT ANYMORE!!

Close to the Falbrook theatre stopped for a quick dinner.  We had drinks first the best vodka served here is Titos. I had the bacon chicken sandwich with avacado. The bun was fresh and toasted on the grill. Served with crispy fries. $10.95 My friend loves the veggie burgers if that's your thing. Casual quick dinning with a relaxed atmosphere. However we did not get the best server tonight. The staff is friendly.  Our server was attentive till our food came then we did by see him much. We needed drinks, napkins, but no sign of him.  The computer system works great to pay your bill and split

Who doesn't like Chili's anyways? I have been frequenting this place for decades and can always rely on consistency and decent food. I love the vast amounts of drink and food options and always leave completely satisfied. for a person like me with a decent size Family it makes life easy when you can bring them and not worry about the noise and mess we are about to create, LOL
The service was good but the food was nasty it was warm and sitting there for a bite .
Really good service n good food, we ordered steaks and chicken fajitas n chips all were perfect

This was an interesting experience. My husband and I haven't eaten at one of these chain esta lisents in years. Possibly 10 years. It was dinner time and we drove past this place and I  quickly talked him into giving it a try. We tried to order regular things that we thought should be good here. We know you don't go to these places for steak or seafood. We got wings, fries, and some California egg rolls.  The fries were standard, the wings were just below that and the egg rolls were bad. They looked like they were cooked from frozen cut in half then put in the oven the next day before they were served to us. The taste was ok. But I couldn't help but think of cpk and cheesecake factory ones that are similar and for the same price!  The positive side of the experience is the waitstaff. They were kind and relatable, even "sneaking" us some extra fries.  I definitely won't be back but the experience was interesting. I really don't know how these places stay in business when there is such great food else where.
Food was surprisingly good however service could improve. Would def come back again  *the Blue José cuervo margarita was AMAZING!

This is our local Chili's. The manager, Andrew, is awesome. We always come here for game day and there is always a spot in the bar area. Service is always friendly and THEY NEVER FORGET ABOUT YOU. The wait staff is super on top of everything and they always remember familiar faces. The chips are actually my favorite...ask everyone I know. I love chips and salsa and by far, Chili's has the best tortillas chips. Food is always great and they have great beers on tap. This Chili's is always our number one standby.

Ordered 6 plates only 5 came out . We asked for our other order and they looked confused. Took 30 min to bring out our last order , but by that time everyone else was already finished . Worst experience at chili's . Last time I'll ever come here .

I don't often write reviews but after just having a terrible experience I thought I should - as a warning to all patrons. Our main server (gabby) was wonderful but even her pleasant demeanor did not make up for the food. I ordered the low calorie chicken dish (which tasted like rubber and was inedible). My son had the crispers (batter soggy). I ordered a cup of chili as I couldn't eat my dinner and that had a sour aftertaste so I couldn't eat that either.  Gabby graciously took my dinner off the bill....and all was good ....but then along came Mark who prompted this review. We paid at the table kiosk and filled in the online review and marked things less than satisfactory. He said "oh no you can't give us that review - it impacts us" and promptly took the console and changed my review! I took it back, and told him his logic was backward and changed the scores back again. In my field of work, I've worked with many restaurants/restaurant chains and can spot when there is a need to implement drastic change .....hoping corporate pay attention and implement change as a result of these kind of reviews before it's too late......
Favorite place for good food , great customer service and that's always a HUGE plus in my book !
Their veggie burgers are disgusting but the dips and chips are really good. My husband eats here a lot and has always liked his food.

We went to this location of Chilis last week for dinner. We got a table very quickly but we had to wait 12 min to get a server. Then it took another 15 min to get our drinks. Appetizers came in way sooner than the drinks. Then the meals. But one of us had to wait additional 10 min for their meals and by that time some of us were done eating. The portion of foods got smaller and our waiter, oh man, this guy was high and out of this world. Terrible terrible service and this was our 3rd time in past two months and it's getting worse and worse every time. It's sad it used to be a great place but NEVER again, at least to this location for sure.

location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Chilis is always good, not great. The service was good. The smokehouse menu was new and interesting.  My meal was actually good despite the corporate feel.

Chili's has really gone down hill from what I remember. The quality and flavor is just not there anymore. The table felt disgusting as did the menu's. I ordered tacos and it was the most oily food i've ever had. I don't think you should call them tacos. My friend ordered one of the sandwiches and it was very dry and bland. Never coming back. Only reason I didn't give one star was because the service at least was good.

Love there margarita pizza there chicken nachos are great Texas cheese fry's are yummy half order is big full order will stuff you  Love the chips and salsa if you like ranch you have to get ranch with the chips and salsa so yummy

Came in for my brothers birthday today, and their wasn't a hostess to help us. We were taken to the table by a gentlemen working the bar area. We were finally seated and the sever took a while to check on us.  It took Evan about 5 mins to bring waters/beer. After bringing our drinks, he took our order. It took the kitchen about 30 mins to make our dinner. The food was really good and tasteful. They messed up on my sandwich, but it was still good the way it came out.  Overall, the experience was good. The menu had a lot of food choices that look really good. I will return for their happy hour all day Sunday's!  FYI: if you grab the machine they have on the table with games.. They will charge your bill .99 cent. It's not posted anywhere, but it will show up on the receipt!
Food never disappoints. Thanks Martin for always providing us with outstanding service.

First table was so dirty wet and we cleaned and after we waiting our food 45 min just burger and taco waiting in 1 hour will never come back .food even not good cold and not tasty and tasted weird hope won't be sick. I don't understand why people coming here. All sucks dirty table. server was nice girl .we will never back here never ever

Giving 4 stars Bc our server Reanna was SO nice and gave us amazing service and was so kind. Knocking off a star for not having Caesar pitas anymore? Or Caesar salads? Whyyyyy :'( thankful for Reanna who made it all better with great suggestions and service.

So happy I live next to a Chilis!  We always get great service every time we come. Even when I wanted something that wasn't on the menu one time the waitress asked in the back and I was serviced the Monterey Chicken since the cook knew how to make it. And I love that the molten chocolate cake comes in a smaller less comatose serving for when my husband doesn't want any.

I certainly have a good time at Chilis. This bar is close and there's always a seat available at the bar or a booth. Yes: they still have those famous: #BabyBackRibs Those aren't really my favorite on the menu, but #iWill keep coming to this bar and grill definitely. It is a lot of fun. It's family-friendly but they serve some really amazing specialty drinks. You can even order Virgin drinks - what more can I say? It's just a cool spot to chill.

Even though the reviews speak for itself, we thought about testing it out for ourselves. Well as we figured..... we should have stuck with the reviews. Dirty tables, horrible food. Just a fast food joint with restaurant prices. Rediculous.

The service was good. The beer is cold and served in a cold glass. Chili's now has decent onion rings.  It had been a year or two since I had been to Chili's for a burger, however, and with my first bite i remembered why. I ordered the burger medium because i like a juicy burger. Nope. It was well-done and dry. I should have gone to Red Robin instead. They always get it right. Next time I will go there or The Stand on Canoga. The Business Burger there is expensive and worth it. It is, hands down, the best burger in the West Valley. I went there the other day and it was marvelous. Bad selection of beers, though.

1star because it's required. I will no longer come here again. This places allows gypsies to come and interrupt your dinner to beg for money. I have never been so disgusted in my life. I cannot believe they allow their patrons to be harassed like this.  NEVER AGAIN!!!  I'll go somewhere where this is NOT allowed.

The place was empty so there's  no excuse for poor service. We had to ask for refills, silverware, napkins and the lettuce in the salad was wilted. The turkey on the sandwich was processed. The enchilada soup was ok but not hot. I couldn't believe how dirty it was. I will never go back to this location.

Was there for lunch on a Sunday. Our drinks were awful. The blended margarita, served in a tall tumbler, didn't taste freshly-blended. My spouse's coconut-pineapple drink was so sweet that we couldn't even drink it. The chips were good. The salsa was good even though it looked and tasted like it had come from a jar. The guacamole didn't look or taste freshly-made. The burger and fries were very good. The fajitas were delicious, although the beef was quite tough. We received the wrong fajitas initially. They were removed before we touched them to be given to another party. The burger sat on the table for several minutes while waiting for the correct fajita order to arrive. It came with flour tortillas instead of the corn we had ordered. The server was friendly and we were bid hello and goodbye at the door, but we probably won't be going back any time soon. Oh, and the music was too loud for conversation.

Came here on a recommendation of the promise of a new menu and innovative tabletop kiosks that allow you to get your order faster. I've been to Chili's all over the country and know them to be in the Applebee's and TGI Fridays department. My expectations were low so there was room for improvement. We walk in the two front doors carrying a baby carrier and navigating our young child and see the host standing by the host stand patiently waiting for us. Realized that holding down the stand was more important than grabbing a door for us. Seated on the side, most tables were crowded. People like their Chili's. We got a nice big booth. They have some nice big HDTVs in the dining area so it's ideal to watch a game. We had grown-up drinks and they were fine. Meals were mediocre and I had no idea what to order. Probably should have gone with a sandwich or salad but the new smothered burritos looked good so I had one. My wife had the quesadilla salad without meat but apparently they don't take a dollar or two off the price even if you hold the protein. If I were in a part of the country without Mexican food, I'd welcome a burrito. But here, it was bland and I could find a better burrito a block or two away. Chili's is the national chain for when there are better options and you don't know the area. We live nearby and know of a several better options. The kiosk/tablet on the table is fine. They have games for kids ... or adults for $1 all you can play. Didn't do that. I used it to sign up for their rewards program. I also ordered another drink and dessert using it. Made it easier but kind of negated the server's job. She asked for a drink refill at one point but I had already told the bartender through the modern technology. Their Oreo topped molten cake, which is according to their menu and website only available for a limited time, is literally their molten cake with one Oreo cookie crushed over it. The photo looks so enticing. It was not desirable and we could be more satisfied going home and eating Oreos. Service was mediocre. I ordered twice from the machine and it felt like the server didn't come around much. I wanted water but never got the chance to order it. I don't want my Chili's. We won't be coming back.

Dear Chili's, You've changed.  It's you, not me.  The one thing I could always count on was a decent (not great, but good) Old Timer Cheeseburger.   You've revamped your menu.  Claims were made of the "Improved" Old Timer.  It used to have a nice soft sesame bun.  Now it comes with a trendy brioche bun.  Kinda dense.  Fries come in a trendy aluminum thing-a-ma-jig. I ordered my burger medium rare.  The burger chef at Chili's decided that wasn't going to happen and gave me a well done burger.  I should have sent it back but I've got a cold and just wanted to gobble this thing down and go back to bed and rest.  It sucked. The Queen of Reseda sabotaged herself and ordered a very wacky dish call the Quesadilla Explosion Salad.  I'll spare you the details.  It sucked.  Perhaps she should have ordered the Pizza Shooters, Shrimp Poppers, or the Extreme Fajitas. Chili's, your not a Gastropub.  Just stop it.

Gross gross gross. Honestly disappointed every time I come here. Service is alright if you can actually get someone to seat you but the food is just terrible. Bland and super cheap tasting. Spend your money somewhere else friends

Don't bother trying to use the save your place app at the West Hills location. They tell you about. I tried using it and was told they don't honor it at this location. I'd recommend trying Stone Fire or Olive Garden or another place near this location for faster and better service.

This restaurant has horrible service. We came in at 12 in the afternoon and received a horrible lunch. I did not get one refill. I ordered fajitas with corn tortillas and the came cold and broken. The second time they brought them to me they were so microwaved that they were stuck together. And we waited so long for them that our meat was cold.

If I could give this location 0 stars I would. Second time here with my family and we waited over an hour. When we arrived all other tables and booths were empty. They filled in AFTER we put in our order yet somehow every table got their food before we did. When we asked to speak to the manager, the manager didn't come. We got up and left our table. Not coming back.

The customer service here is terrible! I've been here many times, I only do to go orders as I come on lunch. Today I ordered online and when I walked in I sat in the to go area for 5 minutes before saying anything to see if anyone would greet me at the very least say hello. Nope! One guy walked past me 5x even went to the register twice that the to go orders are processed on and looked me dead in my face more than once. The "manager" didn't even speak smh. So when I got up I asked a waited for a manager and when he processes my transaction I ask " Do your employees usually not greet guests?" His response "well we are a little full right now"  really? So you're okay with your staff being rude because it's busy? I could see he didn't give a flying %#*% and if management acts that way I see why his employees do smh

Never loved this restaurant, but.. Their weekday happy hour is for sure something to check out. The best time to go is from 9:00pm to close at 10:30pm. It is in the bar and you get free chips and salsa.  SUNDAY Happy Hour: 11:00 AM - 11:00 PM $2.99 ... Boneless Buffalo Wings 5 pieces., Fried Cheese Sticks, Half-Order Texas Cheese Fries, Crispy Onion String & Jalapeño Stack. $4.99 ... Boneless Buffalo Wings 10 pieces with Fries, Nachos, Spinach & Artichoke Dip or Southwestern Egg Rolls. Oh and $1.99 - $2.99 beers and $3.99 margarita's is a HUGE PLUS! It can get a bit busy on Sunday because it lasts all day. During the week the happy hours run from:  3:00pm - 6:00pm and from 9:00pm to 10:30pm Except Friday Its only 3:00pm to 6:00pm. TIP - The menu for happy hour does change a little bit every day so be prepared for that, but most items are available every happy hour! Enjoy =)

My mom and I came here to eat dinner and this place honestly reminded me of hanging with my brother Danny and his babe Heidi. Man I miss those guys.  I'm just ordering the Mango-chile Tilipia with steamed broccoli. That is the  . My mom is getting the baby back ribs & it's all on the 2 for $20 menu. Our beverage of choice: water with lemon. Oh yeah!! Let's get hydrated! Other than that, great conversation, good vibes, awesome waiter, and good food.

Soooo disappointed. My husband was hit on the knee with a server's tray by a waiter as he rushed by. He never even stopped or apologized or anything. When my husband called him over to let him know what happened, the waiter didn't ask if he was ok or anything. Just mumbled something about it being  mistake. We asked for  manager, who never showed up. Now my husband's knee is swolen and in pain.
Beware...don't go in this location. Service is really bad.  Our server sucks...service sucks!!!! We love Chili's but we're so disappointed with everything!

Normally, we avoid weekend to avoid the crowds. However, we went for dinner on Friday. It was packed. We got plenty of time to chat while waiting for our delicious food. Thumbs up for our waiter, Mike. He's very nice, attentive and helpful. Definitely will be back again.

Really disappointed with today's visit here today. The host was sweet and very welcoming. But the waiter didn't even take our order until 10 minutes after. Food was great like always but we had to ask other waiters for refills and even our dessert plate. After we were finished she didn't even come to check on us. We were waiting for at least 15 minutes until we just asked for our own check. Super disappointed how we had the worst service today on a slow day, haven't had this type of service even on a busy day.

Question: how much is 99 cents worth? Answer: less than a dollar. Question: How much can 99 cents cost you? Answer (preface): Last night had a perfectly acceptable meal with perfectly acceptable service.  Booths were a tad uncomfortable (seats too far from the table for a normal sized person) and the light fixture was disgustingly dirty.  But other than that it was perfectly acceptable. Until it was time to pay the bill.  Waiter disappeared and no bill was delivered.  Instead he brought a mobile terminal and said, "Oh... this was supposed to be at your table".  No bill and we needed to go and this terminal was staring us in the face offering to settle the tab.  So we did.  So far so good. But the tip is defaulted to 20% which made me look like a cheap-skate in front of my date as I slid it to a more reasonable number.  Not just looked like one, she actually called me one.  Thanks Chili's... you made me look like a buffoon, and a cheap one at that. Then the bill shows up with a .99 charge for using the terminal. So here's the answer:  a 3-star review is now a 1-star review (minus 1 star for each issue cited above) and I'll never suggest going to Chili's again. Good for you... you got my 99 cents... hope it was worth it to you.

Came in last night for my boyfriend's parent's anniversary. Our waiter never brought water, misheard his mom's order (which was so full of jalapeño it was almost inedible once it got to the table). And I got the cajun chicken pasta that was so salty I thought it was a prank.  I was so done and didn't eat a thing. What happened to quality control???

We have not eaten here for a while.  We went on Sunday when it was happy hour all day.  They now charge $3.50  for tortilla chips and salsa.  The chips were so salty we had to brush off every chip.  I had a Margarita and he had a beer.  We were not too hungry and did not want the greasy calorie laden apps so he ordered a bowl of chili and I ordered a garden salad.  The lettuce was old and wilted and the blue cheese salad dressing was sweet.  The chili was terrible and they only had Tabasco to add a little heat.  I can tell you that Chili"s can not make Chili or salads.  We will not be back.
Chilis disrespects vets. Says they "removed" manager but just moves him to another l

I was very pleased with my experience at this restaurant. I met a friend here for lunch on Friday afternoon just before 4:00 p.m. The restaurant was not too busy and a NBA playoff game was showing on the t.v. screens across from the bar. Our server was very friendly and attentive. I ordered the Prime Rib tacos, a taco trio served with rice and beans. The tacos were really good. The rice that came with it was a little undercooked. The margaritas were huge and the the chocolate molten cake my friend had came free with her meal.

I don't know what to say.I try going to other restaurants but end up being at chillis. This place is amazing, food is good. I never had a problem with service. You get far more than what u pay for. Loveeee Chilli's :)

My first experience at this place was not so good as you may see my previous review.  However I gave it another chance and this time it was actually pretty good. Everything tasted a lot better and the quality of the food has improved a lot.  In addition to that their drink were really good too.

My friend and I stopped by for an early lunch today, a Saturday, and there weren't many people there. We sat at a booth in the bar area and our waitress got to us almost immediately. Drinks came by quick, though we did wait a bit longer than I would have liked for our food. Our waitress was attentive and checked in a couple times, asked if we wanted to-go boxes and brought by the bill without us having to ask.  Today was a good day. There have been times though, when I've stopped in for dinner on a weekday and it's crowded and your order may get taken quick but wait times for food are long and we sometimes have to track the waitstaff down for the check at the end. Food? It's yummy, salty and calorie-laden and most people know that when they decide to go dine here. I love their burgers and Cajun chicken pasta. They also still do their dinner for 2 at $20; an appetizer to share and two entrees, a good deal if you're on a budget. I've taken advantage of the dinner for 2 during lunch hour too, so it's not limited to dinner time only.  They've serve a signature lava cake dessert here; warm chocolate cake with chocolate syrup inside and a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top. It's chocolate heaven.

Came with my two small children for lunch on a Monday afternoon, not busy at all but still our waiter was not attentive at all, he kept on disappearing. I had to ask another waiter for water refill after ours forgot about me, and this guy didn't seem thrilled that I asked him. Burger was ok, so was my kids pizza. Overall, we won't be back, service sucks! Plus the host in the front with a ponytail was not helpful either, just stared into the wall when I asked him a question. And waiters get pissed when a good tip isn't given to them, gee I wonder why!?

Dinner was good. We got the chips and guacamole starter, and for the entrees, ribs and steaks.  Ribs were cooked well, sauce was good, and the fries were nice.  Steaks looked good (no complaints heard), the skillet potatoes were tasty, and the broccoli was steamed nicely, not overcooked. Our server was friendly and polite. Also the host and hostess were pleasant as well.
Hate to leave a 1* but that's actually being generous. Lackluster food, complemented by lackluster service.  A definite DO NOT GO HERE.

Not impressed. Waiter was OK. When the salads came out mine had a big ole hair on it. The girl said oops let me get you another one which came almost instantly. I asked for  a rare steak but it came medium well. I didn't want to wait for a new one so I just dealt with it. My wife ordered some kind of grilled chicken but asked that they not put the habanero drizzle on it as she just had dental work done and didn't think she could handle it. Her first bite was was an exercise in pain as they forgot and put it on anyway. It took a while to flag down our waiter and she asked that they fix her food. I was almost done eating at this point. It took quite a while to get the re-done chicken so I had long since finished my dinner and got to sit and watch her eat hers. After all the waiting she discovered that all they did was scrape the stuff off of the top but it was still screaming hot. She just dealt with it so I took her for ice cream afterwards. With the speed of my hairy salad fix I now have to wonder if they did the same thing for that. Perhaps just picked off the hair and returned it to me. So at that point I left feeling a little grossed out. I wont go back. Ever.

I may be a bit picky and this review may be unwarranted however I went in to get a cup of coffee as I was on a dinner break. I ordered the coffee and to my surprise they charged me $2.50 for a small cup of coffee and to top it off it was friggen cold.  For a $1.69 I should have walked over to the Chevron station and gotten better coffee with all the fixings.  Just crappy and what a bunch of price gougers who do not discount a cup of coffee for someone who works in the same shopping center. Geez!!

I'm never going back here. My husband & I took our friend out to dinner here once.  Yes we were seated right away because we came early.  The hostess was not that friendly.  Then came the server responsible for our table.  When he asked about their tablet on the table, I didn't hear him well so I just asked again what it was that he was explaining.  He then went on to explain it a second time about paying via the tablet doing it ourselves (which was the only cool experience I had on this night) but he did so as if we did not know how to speak nor understand English.  It was very disappointing & I wanted to leave right there & then & just go to the Red Lobster place beside it but my husband felt we had to give them a try. Long wait for the food.  Server not at all friendly nor engaging.  We ordered bottomless chips, fajitas, mini burgers, soups & steak with avocado.  Food was honestly not that great.  Steak I should say was tasty.  However, I was really expecting that their serving would be larger than what I've expected.  It's way smaller now & I don't feel the money was worth paying for the meals in those quantities. Oh well...

I went to Chili's  last night with my wife right before we went to the movies we had a appetizer they have this new thing called choose any three so we pick burgers Buffalo boneless wings and their special egg rolls let me tell you this all three of those items were very tasty they came out very fast our service was excellent and our drinks were good too we had a cocktail and a milkshake I think the next time I go there I would take my whole family... plus they have TVs everywhere and a huge parking lot i hope this will help u guy

Came here tonight for the "Two for $20" dinner.  We got two orders of chicken fajitas, plus an appetizer of chips and guacamole - all for twenty bucks!  That's quite a deal!  Our server, Conor, did a great job taking care of us.  He made sure our drinks were refilled, got our order exactly as we asked and made the whole dining experience easy.  Conor was nice and friendly, too.  Plus, there was so much food, I have plenty left over for dinner tomorrow night.

Feel like late night snack...,. The Service: Sitting at the bar. Bartender is very attentive. Quick service. The Food: I order Cajun Chicken Pasta. The chicken is very dry. The pasta is undercook. The sauce is too greasy.  The Parking: Parking lot (FREE)

Disgusting! We barely touched our food due to the cockroach crawling on the wall in front of us. I grabbed a waitress and told her, she said she would grab something to get the roach with but she never returned, so I grabbed a waiter and he got it off the wall and said we just sprayed so the roaches are coming out. How gross, ruined our appetites. Won't be back for awhile if ever.

The service was horrible, I came with a friend that he's visiting from vegas and one who it is celebrating something so special, but this not going to ruin our night, just want to let them know that it is so rude that the servers are sweeping the flor while people still eating, disgusting!!
Consistency is key, and they seem to have it dialed in with food quality and service attentiveness (but I speak for the bar area only as it is where I sit).

I don't know why I still come here. I guess it's just close and convenient. Food is decent, but nothing I would ever rave about.  Every time I've been here, everything's alway has just been average. Average food, average service, average wait time, etc.  More recently, I had great and prompt service. We ordered the Guacamole (I think it was southwestern?) and found a mysterious black thing in there about the size of a dime. We fished it out and couldn't determine what it was. We asked our waitress and she couldn't figure it out either and said, "I think it might be meat or something". First, I'm glad I'm not vegetarian, or I would literally freak out. Second, gross!  She took it to the back where the manager said it was "just an old piece of avocado". They replaced it, but I pretty much was grossed out by then, constantly checking my food for something they may have missed. Up to this day, I have no idea what that thing was. It wasn't "mushy" so I don't believe it was an old piece of avocado. Dish wasn't comped or anything. As for the mystery thing, don't know, don't care, probably won't be back.

It was a little tough getting in and out of there on a busy lunch hour. Make sure you get your check while you're eating. I love that they still have the soup / salad lunch special. They've had it for a few years now. It's a great deal. You have your choice of soups and salads to choose from and they give you a ginormous bowl of chips with salsa. You can get unlimited refills of the soup/salad. The bf took advantage of that. He was hungry. I ordered the chicken enchilada soup with a house salad. I've always loved the chicken enchilada soup. It was tasty and satisfying.  Yum yum.  It's been a while since I've been to Chili's and I was very happy I came back.  I'll definitely make an attempt to eat during my lunch hour again. Just have to make sure I'm not late getting back to work next time.

Service was terrible, we ask for a refill or napkins or sauce and he never brought anything! Finally at the end when requested the server with the on table tablet we told him we didn't need the drinks and sauce but want the check. He brought us the drinks and sauce with the check. Annoying, my son wanted a bite of my husbands burger he didn't finish and there was plastic pieces in it!!! I was beyond upset, I think steam might have been coming off my forehead. The manager came up to "apologize" absolute ridiculous apology. I would never go back. The plastic in the burger took what was just a bad service experience to a whole new level. I do not recommend.

This has to be the worst chilis I have ever been to. I've never dined in, always to-go. The first time I ordered a triple dipper to go (a few months ago) : southwestern egg rolls, big mouth bites, and wings (bone-in)... Wings were hard like they were sitting for hours. Overall the ordered seemed like it was rushed and thrown together.  I figured I give the place the benefit of the doubt. Decided to place the same order on yesterday. Got to the restaurant in 10 min and my order was done. The waiter on the phone told me it would be approx 15-20 min. Checked to make sure my order was correct and there were boneless wings. No biggie, the waiter took the order back to correct the order. Then when I got home to eat the food , the big mouth bites were literally raw and uncooked. The patties looked like breakfast sausage; that's how undercooked it was. I just threw everything in the trash. Chilis has definitely loss major points with me. I will not be returning.

Years ago this used to be a good place to go, but recently we just give it a try once a year to see if the place changed management yet. Last time we entered the restaurant, a few days ago, my son started to gag from the smell and we went right out. So bad! I cant wait for management to change and the place to become again a good place in neighborhood!

Served UNCOOKED MEAT!  The talapia was served to me with the center still pink and uncooked.  I don't mean the very center but I mean more than half of the meat.  After eating the edges (the parts that flaked off the way cooked fish does), did I discover that the center was not cooked.   Disgusting!!!  How can this happen?  How can the cooking staff not know how to cook fish?  I reported this to the waiter who only asked if I would like something else.  After feeling like I just was poisoned with bacteria, how could I trust the chef to order something else?  Want something else?!  Really?  Think about it.  My appetite was gone and I felt like throwing up.   I have a picture that I'd like to post here as proof that I'm not a humbug or whatever.

It was my first time at a Chili's, because I was curious to try their food. I have to say that I was quite impressed from start to finish. The server was very pleasant and attentive. She came to our table several times making sure we were okay. We appreciated that, because at some places, we had to track down our servers after they disappeared for a long time. The chips and salsa were so good! The cocktails were great, too. The Triple Dipper and Flatbread appetizers were delicious!  I have to say that the food here was tastier and had more flavor than at some of the fine dining establishments I've patroned.  Definitely give this place a try!

Okay so me and my friend was just there I got the chicken salad  and she got the chicken crisper  my chicken salad was warm and the chicken was cold and hers was way over cooked along with the corn was not good and we got ICE tea but there was NO ICE!!!!!!!! WE ARE NEVER COMEING THERE EVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

service was a bit slow and bathrooms were dirty.  i also asked the waiter if he could run my credit card in his register rather than the machine on the table. I ended up with identity theft the last time i used it that way.  He was muttering under his breath that I was so inconviniencing him.  I really didnt appreciate that.
Food is always good. I love their fries! The service is always good too. I personally like this location more than any in the valley. It gets less crowded. Plenty of parking. Good ambience.

Very Nice place .. friendly servers and the food is super super yummy , tasty wowww extra ordinary.. I love the salmon and grill chicken salad. those are my fav!! the best grilled chicken ever ever :)  There is a Gentleman server who is so nice and care about customers professionally ..you can order food or  pay your bill on the table they have card reader and that's interesting.  I like this place and  really recommend it :) just go and enjoy..

Whenever I walk into a restaurant after standard peak hours, I try not to expect too much. When demand slows down, so does the service, generally. I'm pleased that this Chili's had great service; our server was bubbly, bright, and friendly. It was just the food that was utterly unremarkable. It was all cooked just fine, and the custom changes we'd made were implemented, it just didn't taste like very much at all. I guess we'll stick to those peak hours in the future, after all.

I love Chili's but I've had my fair share of bad service but that was not the case tonight! My roommate and I were lucky enough to have Gabby as our server. She was super sweet! She was also very effiencet and got out drinks to us immediately! She made great conversation and anticipated our needs. She didn't hover and she didn't go missing! Gabby deserves acknowledgment for her hard work! Go Gabby!
We waited for 20 mins and no one came to help us to get sat down. Servers would just look at us but wouldn't bother to help.

$2/20 Fajitas , we ordered the chicken pork comb and then the steak and slicecd the steak for the steak fajitas. Guacamole appetizer  I liked because its not too garlicky and there aren't large chunks of onions.  The order yourself desert and apps and check out kiosk is interesting, and makes you see less of the server, which to me would equal less of the tips, so those can't be good for servers.  I like the quick check out part, but It would be nice to see the server and get their opinions on apps and deserts.  Unfortunately they sat us in the kids sectin and by a huge party of like 16 ppl w 4 or 5 kids.  Overall its ok. Its Chilis. Its a family restaurant so expect large families.

I always go to this bar with my boys on Sunday. It's always happy hour on Sundays so what can be so wrong? Nothing. The service I have always received from the staff is simply amazing. They are so attentive and make sure you have everything you little belly desires. The bartender (blonde girl) Is so dope! She talks to you like a friend and she's always checking your beer/mixed drink to see if you need a refill. I will continue to come here.

Great food. The dr.pepper ribs are to die for, seriously! Food is great and delish... Make sure you stop here! Also, they have a great 2-for-20 deal and their chips and salsa are freshly fried and delish. Love this place!!!!

location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Albeit the poor ratings on Yelp, we used to get some to go food from this place once in a while.  I can almost promise you that after last nights experience, that will never happen again.  Right out of the gates, we noticed that they've changed the menu.  That's reasonable enough as all restaurants do that periodically.  But we noticed that almost all of our favorite items are no longer available.  To be fair, we ALL tried new items and they were ALL CATEGORICALLY INEDIBLE!  From the tough steak, to the God-awful fried chicken, to the ground up broccoli and the Uncle Bens instant rice it was all bad.  $60 later, we were having grilled cheese sandwiches for dinner.  Never again! Good luck & good riddance.

My roommate and I came here on Thursday night before our movie and had a great time. Our server Gabby took very good care of us and was able to guide me through the menu and answer all my questions. I love being able to come to a restaurant where the service is fast and friendly! Keep smiling Gabby! :D

So the only thing preventing a 1 star rating is that our server was actually pretty attentive. The location is near the theatre (our main event that night) and other restaurants. We waited about 10 minutes to be seated so that the hostess could find a table and find menus....they were out of menus so she gave us to go menus which supposedly had the same items as a regular menu.  They don't have appetizers on the to go menus though.  The kiosks are dirty and you can only order dessert and pay with them. All other items are view only to include drinks.... So we waited about 5 more minutes for a server to arrive and take our order. He was shocked we had to go menus and was going to find us real ones but we were ready to order. The cups for our drinks looked gross. I presume they were washed, but just not clean looking.  We split the artichoke dip and the mango grilled chicken...except the artichoke dip has been replaced with a mozerella melt thing. Despite its appearance: really good.  Food was alright but the location was disorganized, unprepared and unkempt. I don't want to go back there.

Don't go there 30' before closing time, female blonde bartender who's off shift is loud and jumping over the bar to tell her male co-worker bartender how to close his shift, there's lots of cussing while parents with kids having dinner a few feet from the bar, I had to ask if I could order my plate....really ? Good thing is that the bartender knew his female co-worker embarrassed him and offered me nachos on the house and then on the other hand he starts talking to his regulars and being a joker thinking  I didn't notice...First and last time I go here...

When we first arrived the host was attentive and we were seated immediately with no problem.  Once we were seated we waited about 30 min before the waiter showed up, he took our order for drinks and appetizers and left. We still had the menus when he came back to drop off the drinks and appetizers, he left once again to get straws and then disappeared.  We waited for another 30-45 minutes, but the waiter never came back  to take our order (he left us with the menus in hand). There was also problems with appetizers which were never addressed. We paid on the machine and left disappointed.

OK food. Too salty, old lettuce, chicken is always cold. Last time I was here was three years ago, and the food is still Ehhhh....but the service is good. I'd probably not come back here, unless we have to. There are  so many better choices around with the same price. Good service & mediocre food.
What a great staff! Great food as well! Hands down my favorite chain bar and grill!  That's all I had to say but I did not hit the minimum. Really a great place!

Our server her name is Gabby she was bar none the best ! Very attentive addressed  all of our concerns and needs. Sit in her section for great service. We have never had a bad experience here but she really stuck out...

Had lunch around 230pm today at this location today and the service was fantastic. The host was very welcoming and the server checked back often and was very accommodating. The food quality was overall pretty good and the restaurant interior was clean. Atmosphere wise, it was too cold. AC felt like it was set at 70 degrees! Upon exiting, I noticed lots of trash and debris throughout the landscaping in front of the restaurant. It looked like the area had not been maintained for weeks or months! Disappointing to see this at such a landmark location like this.  The good news, I will still be back because Chili's is awesome!

Everyone we encountered was so friendly and attentive, but other than that there was much left to be desired.  We arrive, were immediately greeted by a friendly host, and seated right away. The floor of our booth had chips, a piece of carrot, a lemon slice and paper towels scattered around. The entire restaurant had the same unkempt look. I've dined at the chilis in Northridge many time and it's never looked that neglected.  In our area, three different tables complains about the food or drink they received. I asked for no onions or sauce on my order and it came with both. Another table complained that the chips were too salty while a different table complained that the drink tastes watered down. We experienced salty food as well as a watered down alcoholic beverage.  It's a shame that this place has so few stars when I know a few changes could make it a delightful place to eat.
Yesterday night was my 2nd time dining at this location. Delicious food and great service from Andy what else can I ask for;) Great location close to AMC theater and retail shops

My salmon with citrus chilli sauce was pretty good, but sauce was too salty.   They forgot the broccoli and was brought out later which was steamed just right. The citrus Chile rice was undercooked.   Service was great.

Mediocre food. My dad ordered a room tempature water since he doesnt like cold water and they gave us warm water. We told our waiter about the warm water and he brought us HOT water for tea. He didnt understand we wanted room tempature after we told him 2 times. The chicken enchilidas were overall pretty good. Fast service too. But the food kinda seemed like the frozen food trays you buy at the grocery store to reheat.We also had to wait 10 minutes to be seated when the place was practically empty. Our experience was overall normal but nothing special. Kinda overpriced too. I have been to a better chilis. Defiantly will not return to this one.

Salty food. I ordered the avocado chicken sandwich and the chicken was incredibly salty. Slow service. Our waiter only checked on us once and we couldn't get his attention but when we finally did, he took forever to bring napkins and hot water for our tea. Dirty restaurant. Dust everywhere. Window cells very dirty.  Floors were dirty. We will never return.

Worst service and place ever!!   I HAD to create a yelp account just to say this.  Went two weeks ago and the tables were dirty, went again and the tables were still dirty. Messed up my order, hair in food, etc. etc. etc.  I would have left a review using the tablets on the table but the waiter practically yanked it out my hand.  Saying he was going to help me print my receipt.    THAT was the cherry on top. He knew what he was doing.  NEVER going back.   YUCK.
Great Chili's flavor. Friendly servers. Love using the tablets to order dessert and pay the bill. Loyal customer.

My waiter,  Paul,  stroked my back & leered at me after singing "Happy Birthday" to me. I felt this was very inappropriate,  & I complained to both the night manager & the day manager about it,  but they are men & didn't seem to take me seriously. Avoid this restaurant!!

Ordered the onion rings, they were overcooked and the onion in them was smaller than a skinny worm. It appeared to be about the breading. Someone is not paying attention. The desert ice cream brownie thingy that came hot in a pan was great.  Service was great. They refunded the cost of the onion rings when I told them they sucked.  The little computer device on the table was cool. You can look at the menu, pay your bill, or play games for .99 cents. It also plays advertisements, which is a bit weird, but did not bother me. I think it's a clever idea and definitely the wave of the future.

This place sucks. The only reason we come here is because Bama,the bartender, is awesome... And the bud lite is cheap... And there are free chips. Their TV situation is pretty good. PS, Cowboys are garbage.

They have these new screens at your table that you can look at the menu or drinks and even play unlimited games for 99¢. I got the new blackberry margarita which was really good especially for $8. The food has definitely gotten better from before. But it's still not the best food out there. It took awhile for our drinks to come but other than that our service was awesome. I like that in the screens you can pay for you bill on there and don't have to wait for the waiters to come

I liked the two for $20 deals, but my hubby and son wanted to order separately...  Its' okay with me because I wasn't paying!! I had the shrimp baja tacos.  I loved it.   My son had the chicken Caesars salad, (so little amount of chicken) My hubby got the full rack (so small it looked like a half rack) I had the margaritas and all I tasted was the mixer.   I hope they improve because I dine here often.
Not very impressed with the food here. Everything looks way better in the menu photos.

I'm the first one to give kudos for good food and good service.  Unfortunately this establishment provided neither.  We got up and left after being seated for 40 min, and receiving nothing other than water 20 minutes after arriving.   The hostess even came by and exclaimed surprise that after 15 min nobody had come by.  That's the only reason we got the water.  We asked to speak to the manager at 40 minutes.  He said he didn't know what the issue was.  He did not apologize nor offer to immediately find out what the issue was.    Oh and on top of it, we were being blasted with cold air from an AC vent, and was told they probably couldn't do anything about it,and didn't offer to move us. Bottom line here.  RUN away from this Chili's.  Terrible service and poor management.

Chips & Salsa, Chips & Salsa Buffalo Wings, Buffalo Wings Sweet & Sour Chicken Sandwich, Chicken Crispers, with Ranch, Best fries ever, best fries ever. So Chili's is the, where should we go, since the WHOLE family wants to go to dinner, and it's really hard to try and fit 15 people and feed 15 people in a timely and orderly manner. Chili's. baby back ribs, oh wait, back to my review.  This one is always packed, but it seems like it's never too bad with a big group, we only waited about 25 minutes, and we weren't squished into a little table. As packed as they were, they actually sent over 2 servers to help us, and take our orders. With 4 kids, you would think they would have had a problem, nope, not these guys. They brought the kids their food while the adults had our appetizers, and our salads. Service-5+ Their burgers, chicken crispers(usually, when they aren't soggy, yes sometimes they sit wherever they are, and the bottoms get a little soggy, try ordering the chipotle ones, you will never know)salads, chips and salsa, southwestern eggrolls, shrimp tacos, chicken fajitas, and of course their ribs, are all personal favorites of mine. Oh and the Chocolate Molten Cake, and Brownie Sundae for dessert. Food is always a 5+, unfortunately this time, because of the soggy crispers, which were still good, and the fact that we had to ask for extra dressing with every salad(they give you one little cup, and a HUGE plate of salad) I had to mark it down a little bit-4 The bar, try the MARGARITA, I suggest starting with that. Its a signature. The Patron or the Platinum Presidente are my 2 favorites, you can also try the trio as well. The bartenders can make almost anything, and they can make a Scooby Snack, unfortunately it just wasn't to her liking so because of that. Drinks-4 Overall, we love coming to chili's, the service, the food, the drinks, oh yeah, and I almost forgot to mention the Chicken enchilada soup, on those cold nights, you can't ask for anything better. Overall-4

So Chili's had been a fair option for dinner.  And tonight was my daughter's birthday dinner and her choice of restaurant.  Now, its never going to be a fine dining experience.  However, I do have some expectations of quality and service.  Tonight, we had neither.  Our Server was a very nice person, but her attentiveness and speed was poor.  She took our order and disappeared for some time.   We had to ask for drink refills from a different server and we didn't have enough silverware.  Now on to the food.   My daughter said the Mac and Cheese was dried out.  The other Kids Cheese burger bun and my Buffalo Ranch Bun was crusty and nasty,  They also changed the the fried chicken breast patty too (no good!!!).  Now, part of the food disappointment might have been a function of it sitting under a heat lamp.  In any case, the experience was captured perfectly by my 8 year old...  "Dinner was Gross!!!"

It's good old American bar food. The wait staff is hit or miss, either very hot or icy cold. A plus is the new craft made burgers & the delish housemade pickles plus the tablet for the kids. I  also appreciate the option of being able to pay without tracking down the waiters. However it has encouraged negligent behavior on the part pf the wait staff.

Good service, food was good enough! The boneless buffalo wings are bomb, but the burger buns are really dry. I like the little screens on the table where you can pay and leave when you want, so you don't have to wait for the waiter at the end when ur done eating!

The service was great here. Our waiter was friendly and had a good sense of humor.  Everyone that came by to bring food or drink had a real good attitude. Our appetizer came out missing the chicken but it was quickly corrected and 2 people apologized for it.   Having sam Adams Oktoberfest on tap is a plus by far too.  The food was pretty good. Everything came out hot and tasty. We ordered one rack of ribs with mashed potatoes and Mac n cheese and they split it for us nice and even so we could share.  We had just come in for a beer and appetizer but ended up getting more food cause everything was so good.   It was slow in there for a Friday night but I did not mind that at all.

I have officially gotten sick here twice. I gave it a year to see if maybe the cooks changed, or management, but nope. Went back this week and got sick. And, both times the food didn't even taste like Chili's food at other locations. Won't be going back.

This is a fantastic place to visit and eat.  The menu has something for everyone which is expertly prepared and served hot or cold, depending on the unique item. The kitchen staff really knows how make the food attractive as well as delicious. Sometimes it looks almost too good to eat.  The service staff can't seem to run out of opportunities to come by your table to see if everything is ok, or you needs something else. Wow, do they really pamper you and make you feel like you are a VIP.  On a recent visit I had a server whose name was Evan. OMG, he gave so much good service that at times I felt like he owned the place. He not only took excellent care of my food needs, but patiently and completely helped me through all the table Ziosk instructions for ordering and paying for my food. He demonstrated well trained and caring customer service skills.  I can hardly wait for my next visit to this Chili's.

Food just was OK, but customer service was terrible! The guy with tall spike hair just shooting the straw and food in the rude way on the table, I can't find the manager to complain about this guy , I believe they should first teach this guy how to do customer service I never ever go to this chili's ! Not satisfied at All!

After going to Chucke e Cheese my girls and I came here for a bite to eat. The server recommended the Cajun chicken except I didn't love it so he offered to make me something else... Not many waiters do that anymore and so I am impressed and very pleased with the service I received tonight. He brought me the menu and suggested some other items. I just want to say thank you to my wonderful server Evan for making my night. He put a smile on my face and satisfied my tummy. Thumbs up to service !!!

The food was just ok. The service was pretty good. Connor our waiter was quite nice and efficient. We ordered the cheddar bites and sent them back. Terrible. Like chewing rubber bands. We both ordered salads. Mine was a buffalo chicken salad that was great.  The reason for 3 stars is the restaurant was filthy. The front doors were so greasy looking with finger prints everywhere. The hostess could make better use of time by wiping those doors down occasionally instead of just standing around doing nothing... Just a suggestion.  We always try to sit in the bar as its first come first served. Again, the tables felt unkept. The condiments on the table ALL felt gummy. We literally felt we needed a shower upon leaving. I don't think we will be back. Sad, because it looks as though the restaurant has just been renovated.  As a company, I would seriously look at management pertaining to these cleanliness issues. Very simple to fix but such a detriment if ignored. Again, just a suggestion

I have been in other chilies and some I like some I didn't  This chillies is deferent because I realized today how important the servers are and how deferent your experience becomes with the right server ! Came here with my boys and wife and in laws this guy Shane absolutely took care of us and that's a pretty hard thing to do considering my 18 month old boys needed a very patient service shane  totally took care of us and even changed the food I didn't like !! Oh yes fish tilapia sucks and the burgers are great

According to my receipt, my servers name was Andrew or. Andrew was great. It was pretty busy and the food took longer then usual, but he was great. He kept checking in and making sure we had what me needed and made sure to let us know our food was almost ready. Nice guy and great service. We love chilies :) thanks Andrew

My experience here was horrible! The waiters messed up my drinks and then dropped my food along with my cups. My food was cold and took forever to arrive at my table. The bathrooms are ugly, the tables are sticky, and the ground has left over food. I had three different waiters and all had done something wrong. While my food was good, I don't think I'll be dining in ever again.

Haven't had a bad experience at this nor any other chilis. I like the drinks and food here. We usually sit in the bar area and we are served in good timing. I absolutely love the chips and salsa. Good way to start. I like the renovated restaurant, makes it look great.

Well I did it again, didnt read the reviews before going to dinner here.  Now im left wondering if someone put another number in front of my tip amount like poor Danis H... But honestly,  I am kinda happy I didnt read them since alot of the reviews look pretty bad, because without reading them left me open and not walking in with a I'm just waiting for something to happen attitude.   We had a great experience, we had two servers, maybe there was some training going on, but either way it was double the customer service. They were great. Food was good and satisfying for what I have learned to know is chilli's food.  We got the two for $20.00 x two, this way we had 2 appetizers and four entrees. Took dinner home to alex, and me and Nik both had lunch for the next day too!  We love having alot of variety, cheese sticks, chips, gauc and salsa, pizza, ribs and bacon burgers. I wonder which one of us is going to get a mini stroke first !!? Next stop... Veggie grill?

I've never been to Chli's before, only heard about it in the movies like "Hall Pass". So I've decided to try it and went there for my lunch break. My waitress, Kasi, was very nice, sweet and professional. She got my order right away and brought it to my table as soon as it was ready. I wish more wait staff was like her. I've ordered lunch combo: Salad, Chicken Sandwich and fries. They didn't have Caesar salad in the lunch menu, but Kasi told me that I could still order it and it wouldn't be a problem.  The salad was good, fresh romaine lettuce, cheese, croutons and dressing, as soon as I finished that Kasi brought me the sandwich and fries.  I was really surprised to see only 10 (TEN) potato strips on my plate :) It was kind of funny though, 'cause you'd think if you're going to serve someone fries, you could at LEAST cut up and fry one whole potato :) Seriously, I've never seen smaller side order of fries :) It didn't bother me that much though. The sandwich was VERY good. The chicken was just off the grill, seared on the outside, juicy on the inside. I don't know what sauce did they use, but it went very well with grilled chicken. I loved it. The sandwich was A+, I will definitely come back for more. The only problem that I had with my order was WATER! It was UNFILTERED, tap water. I know it's free and I shouldn't expect much, but I shouldn't be drinking water with chlorine dioxide taste ... My best guess is that they haven't changed their water filter in a while, so I asked Kasi to bring me Iced Tea and take away that horrible water. Good place, I will try it again for lunch!

I'm going to keep this opinion rather short and sweet. Chill's is such a great place to go to with your family. Like many other of my reviews I usually say that the service is great and that the food is great also. Both of those things are true. Personally I love Chili's different varieties of ice tea. I love almost all of their burgers too. I all go to Chili's it's worth the price.
