I used to not have any bad opinions or good opinions about this particular Chili's, but on my most recent visit, it just wasn't an enjoyable experience.  My friend and I wanted some classic American food, so we thought our local Chili's would be great.  Suprisingly it was very busy at 8pm on a Saturday because we had to wait close to 40 minutes.  It's great that they're busy, but waiting for so long already set the tone for a bad evening.   We were finally seated at a 2 person booth, and we didn't even get menus!  I had to ask the waitress to give us our menus!  That took about 10 minutes.  We were ready to order, but the waitress was never to be found; she was maybe gone for 20 minutes!  She finally raced over to our table, and we ordered.  The food took a long time to.  In addition, she never came to our table during our meal to check up on us; it was like "here's your food, don't bother me, I'm busy".  Don't even get me started on paying!  It took the woman 20 minutes to process our receipt, and give her our cards.   Overall, I wouldn't recommend going to this place.  If you don't mind waiting for 1.5 hrs without any food go ahead; you definitely will have a fun time then!

Been about 5 weeks since I have been there. Went there for lunch 2x in one month. Both times it took over 1 hour to get our lunch after we ordered. We were there almost 2 hours in total both times. Both times the waiter stated that one chef did not come in.....where is the manager, he should be pitching in. Will never go back to this location

Can't have a worse place to go on a Sunday night,  45 minutes for a dinner salad and an hour for a burger that was not good. Also if you make a special rwqueat like no sauce on a raco they will screw that up too.

It is really sad to go to a restaurant and get upset because I wasted my money.  I went to Chili's at Fallbrook. ..what a disappointment!  I ordered a ribs... they were: cold, just bones and a horrible bar-b-Q sauce...honestly a horrible food...lousy service!
I had recently went & the food was amazing. The service was excellent i was satisfied with my needs. Andy our waiter was by far the best. I hope you guys keep up the great service.

I would give Chilis 3.5 stars if I could. Overall a good place to check out if you need a quick bite or have some time to kill. The food isnt really outstanding and neither are the drinks but I enjoyed having a meal here. The service was very good and I especially liked the iPad style on the edge of the table. Not only can you see the specials and featured items quickly but you can do things like "Order another round of drinks"! Even better, you can swipe your card and pay for the meal, add tip and just leave whenever you're done!! No more doing that air signing thing to the waiter requesting the check (then waiting for the check, getting it, giving them your card, waiting for it to come back, adding tip and signing it) :)

I wasn't expecting a gourmet meal...but when you're hungry and in a crunch, what can you do? As far as chain restaurants go, Chili's is usually pretty decent.  They seated us right away, which was great but it took awhile for the waiter to come and take our orders.  We had my one-year old nephew with us, so we needed to get a kids meal for him. We ordered the mac and cheese, which was basically boxed kraft mac and cheese. Don't get me wrong, growing up I used to love that stuff but I just feel like they could have had their own homemade type of deal. So we ordered our drinks and our meals. Luckily we asked to put a rush on the kids meal because my nephew was getting hungry. Good thing we did because our meal took another maybe 20 minutes after his meal came out. I started picking at the mac and cheese...what could I do?  Here's the kicker though... Finally our meals came out and we started to eat when I saw something crawling down the wall from the corner of  my eye. When I looked over I didn't see anything but I asked my sister-in-law who had a better angle to see behind the stuff on the table. She definitely saw something. Of course, I slid over to the opposite end of the table as far as I could go. She told me not to think about it, but I couldn't help it. Finally the little creature landed on the table. It had two really long antennae. We tried to get the waiter's attention, which eventually he did and grabbed the bug with the napkins sitting on the table.  Eek. Not what I had in mind when I went out to eat.  A few minutes later, another person came out and asked me if I was ok. She didn't introduce herself so I didn't know if she was a manager but she did apologize for the incident and said they were going to call an exterminator right away. I know this sounds snotty but I was really hoping they would have somehow compensated for the meal-perhaps a free dessert or drinks? When you go to a restaurant, you go not only for the food, but the experience...and this was not a good one.  Aside from the bug incident, not once did a waiter come to ask how our meals were, if we needed refills on anything and when we needed our check I needed to find someone who was not our waiter since he was MIA for a good part of the meal.  I'm ranting, I know but I had to do it....

So let me just start by saying the staff gets 5 stars from me. Very friendly, attentive and nice. Food was so- so  I had the steak and shrimp fajitas and the shrimp tasted like frozen shrimp. I also ordered FRESH guacamole that was like $6 and it came in this little side dish and was NOT fresh. It's forsure pre-made and maybe fresh diced tomato and onions mixed into it. LOVED that device on the table where you can play 30+ games for .99 is brilliant, keeps kids occupied while you finish your food. When I return it will probably only be for the deserts! Yummy

I go through phases with Chili's.  I discover something new on the menu and frequent until I'm bored.  Stay away for a while, until I pass one and think, "haven't been there in a while, let's go see what's new".   There are some steady items on the menu I like, but I have no soup options since they stopped serving the Tortilla soup.  I'm currently hooked on the steak and broccoli dish on the lighter menu. Wait time can get bad during rush hour.  When it's just us two we hit the bar where you can get full menu service.  Service is usually ok. I don't know if yelp has any offers, but FourSquare has a free chips and salsa and a free dessert that alternate every 2nd or 3rd visit.

I ordered the Monterey chicken with broccoli, garlic mash and grilled shrimp tacos,... Most people expect the food to be very close or just like the pictures on the menu,... Right? Else what's the point? I got served boiled chicken mushy broccoli and grey ish mash,... Dryed out tacos with pitted brown avacado   Watered down pico salsa and boiled un seasoned shrimp,.... I kindly looked at the waitress and sad really,..  She looked at me like I was crazy and was surprised when I rejected both plates,... So the waitress takes it back, and instead of making new ones the cook took the boiled chicken Breast and slapped it on the grill then back on the same plate with the now cold grey mash and cold watered broccoli back to my table,..... I said with a smile,.. I kinda knew you would do that,... So I paid for my tea,... And still left the retarded waitress a tip,... We need a cooking channel show that catches waiters serving like this and fire them on the spot,.... Then fire the manager as well :) Will call the show,... Waiter hunt :) Bui

To be honest the waiter was really good so it gets a 4 star or it would have been a 2 star. The food so so not a big deal. I am probably rating it higher than anyone else because I didn't experience a problem being it was my first time at a Chili's. I ordered Fajita's and I prefer El Torito's Fajita's instead.

I didn't read any reviews before I wrote this. I've been here several times for Friday lunches with my co-workers. There is ample parking, the wait is never long, the staff is nice, the food is good and fairly priced, they have a good lunch menu as well as a nice $20 special for 2 and there are TVs everywhere. Perfect lunch place for me.

How hard is it to bring water?! Seriously! Customer service sucked. You can go anywhere and go to a place like this. This is commercialism at it's best. So when you get crap customer service, just makes it worse. I asked for water like 5 times, ok probably 3 in actuality but that's a lot considering it was like 100 degrees outside and the water never came. This was 3 different times throughout my meal! He said "Ok" every time. I thought to myself "You really want to keep me thirsty so I buy another beer". Not this time bub! I ain't the one.  ...and the food was not worth what I spent on it.

Painfully slow service! We ordered the fajitas, I used to get these all the time but they have since changed them. It was a change fir the worse. They have new tablets in the tables fir the kids to play with. That's great but the service was so slow those didn't even keep their attention through the meal. I am soo disappointed! I will stick to my normal chilis in Northridge.

Been a while since I've been here but they've remodeled since, looks good.  We didn't have to wait too long for a table (we had 6), but it was a little irritating that 2 of the huge booths were taken by couples when 2 and 4 seaters were abundantly available.  I got the half rack of ribs, shiner bock style. Came out really good, perfectly cooked, hot and the meat feel off the bone. Fries came out about 5 mins later but piping hot. Overall average experience, no huge problems and service was good. All good came out in appropriate time and hot.

We've been coming to this chillis for 13 years, at least once a week. Never had any issues at all, decent food, excellent service. That was at least until today. I understand that when the restaurant is slow you want to cram everyone onto one side of the restaurant, it's efficient. But to walk a family of 4 past a row of  empty booths to a table, and then when asked if a booth is possible, reply "there are no booths available", is borderline bad business. When it crosses the border is when 4 minutes later those empty booths magically became available, just not for us. I usually don't make a big deal abou these things but it had been a long day and we were really looking forward to that booth. I understand there are classes and seminars about restaurant efficiency, but then there's also one person you need to keep in mind that helps keep it all going, the customer. Gotta find another pre movie place to go to, another stop after the father daughter dance, but I don't run a business like this and can't support someone who does.
I had the chicken fajitas on the 2 for 20 meal.  The chicken wasn't bad but the tortillas were old and hard. Service was fast.
This is a ok Chili's only because I have been to a better one with better customer service.

Tonight's waitress 8/13/2014 wasn't too nice.  She was working at the bar section. 7:15pm. What happened was they give free chips and salsa up to 7p(we didn't know).  We got there only 2min late, by the time she came to our table it was 710p & I asked about the free chips & salsa and she gave us this attitude & said, it's over. It's already after 7p.   So the one star is for the service.

While the food is the same quality one would expect at any Chili's, witnessing a waiter handle my food with his bare hands is not what I'd expect.  I watched a waiter clear tables, carry dirty dishes, handle money and then pick up a handful of fries with his bare hands and put them in my to-go container.  The good news is I had no appetite after that so, yay diet!  Too bad I couldn't give three stars for the food and zero stars for the service.

This is my boyfriends favorite place to go to. However, my last experience was bad. When we got there, The hostess told us it was going to be five minutes for us to get some seats. 10 minutes passed by and we finally got a table. Walking to our table we see at least five tables unoccupied.  The food we ordered was way to salty and greasy (something I haven't experienced before.) The service was HORRIBLE!!!!!! We rarely saw the waitress and we sat there for about 20 minutes for them to give us the check. Either way we had to wait while every time we needed anything.

So sloooow. We're here now, got here at 9:05 it is now 9:40! Woooo I just love to wait! 10 people are here for happy hour in the bar... Why is it taking so long!? I would feel bad if it's only 1 chef back there, reading the other reviews it seems like they are short staff in the kitchen which is a damn shame :( JUST GOT THE FOOD! I'm saddened to announce my boyfriends turkey sandwich is ice cold... Can you say FOOD POISONING!?    Yet again were playing the waiting game to get the bill. We won't waste anymore time so we have our credit cards out! Even though the food wasn't great, the waiter will still get her tip because she's very nice, and I know what it's like to live on tips :(    Overall, chilis needs more help in the kitchen!! I hope a manager sees this and fixes the obvious problem!
Staff were nice. Big Bar area and you can get full menu at bar as well. 2 Soup options Daily; chicken noodle served every day.

I used to go to Chili's West Hills all the time. After today never again. I'm so mad. The hostess was not helpful and did nothing to help seat my party of 7 at 3:00 on a Saturday afternoon. She said we would have to wait 15 to 20 minites. Really?? Is our money not good here?  My family and I took our business elsewhere!!

The food tasted fine, nothing special at all.  I guess i was expecting a bit more.  The chili was not that great.  Side salad was disappointing.  Flatbread was pretty darned good...we got it for free because we had coupon.  Also got appetizer plate with mini burgers and wings/celery, which were fine.  $5.99 for a beer, and $4 for a bland strawberry lemonade.  The bill came to $26---can't complain.  The service was excellent (5 stars for service, 3 stars for food.)  Waiter was superb and got the food out to us in a reasonable amount of time.

This Chilis has had a nice update to the decor since I have last been there- but for me, it's all about the Queso!  Three stars because although the queso was yummy as usual, the made the cast iron pan they serve it in smaller (again!!!).  Service wasn't consistent, either...  Our waiter must have gone on a lunch break, or something; we kept getting people who were "filling in" for him, which was ok, but lead to the inconsistency.

Have been a regular at this location many times in the past and returned again tonight. This last year they had some issues with the air conditioning system and some service issues but.... Chad S. of Customer Service did his job and made things right and the bad is now all good once again!  Thank you Chad! Glad to see the customer service is much better and the AC issues got taken care of. Our waiter tonight was Anthony and he was excellent. We never really had much of any food issues here, the food is always good and the Triple Dipper is a great bargain and their new mashed potato skillet is awesome. This last year (2014) was a bit of a rough one for this location but things have improved greatly. So when Chad says he wants to make things right with customers that might have had a bad experience, he means it and takes care of it. I will be back to location with my family like we have many times in the past. Just very happy and pleased all the issues got fixed because I always loved this Chili's and didn't want to have to drive the extra miles to go to the Northridge location. Thanks again Chad S. Your customer service is great and keep up the good work! And Anthony is a great waiter and should be considered for management in the future.  Hope to see you there next time so I can shake your hand.

I'm not a big Chili's fan or any other restaurant of the same genre.  However, every once in awhile it's convenient to go to one of these places for a meal.  We sat in the lounge to watch MNF.  The wife and I intended to do their 3 for $20 deal.  Unfortunately, this time around, the chicken fried steak was not included in the special.  So we ended up getting a chicken fried steak dinner as well as some appetizers.  It's good to know that happy hour runs throughout every pro football game.  Our server was Katie and she was very good.

Went there last Friday with family. The server was just ok. We had to ask him several times for refills on drinks. He apologized,and told us it was the kitchens fault. Likely story. Two stars, because the acoustics were bad; and the service was so-so. I probably won't be back anytime soon.

It's okay for it being around the block and walking distance from CSUN. I always feel like we're being ignored when we want to order or get the check. Gets pretty busy during lunch. I'd come here again.

I am sitting here as I speak, waiting for about 45 minutes for my food. And that is not including how long we waited for our waiter to take our order. This is not the first time. I always come back here having hope but this chilis always fails me.

I like Chilis as a company or a restaurant in general but this location has problems. We had a very bad experience eating here before where they forgot about our orders. Dropped our dishes and and had to take it back. They also moved our table in the middle of our meal so they could accommodate a bigger crowd that was coming for their birthday.  The Manager came over to apologize. They even gave us free Desert but after all of it we all ended up getting stomach aches and diarrhea. We have since then sworn off this place.  Man I wish we had yelp a year ago I could vent my frustrations.

My wife and I go here frequentlyafter a workout at the gym across the way. I know its a chain and all, but the Chicken Margarita is so delicious I cant stop going back and having the same thing again and again. Service is pretty good too. Credit card monitors at the tables are a bit annoying though but we just turn it the other way.

West Hills is our local Chilies. We visit it about once a week.  We  went in today for dinner, my wife and I . Food was good, and service was good. BUT while visiting the rest room a regular patron at the bar urinated on my shoe.  Well after a few words with the obviously over served drunk I went to management. Today's manager was Joe. He said that he would take care of the situation. Nothing was done. I guess Joe  would rather have regular unhappy, piss on their shoes customers than to take responsibly for a drunk that his establishment over served.

Food is inconsistent as the service is consistently bad. We have eaten here many times over the past year and it just continues to get worse.  Food is often either overcooked or under cooked (rarely as requested).  It is very difficult to eat sensibly if you prefer as everything is packed in calories.  Service is slow and spotty on good days.

I was able to schedule a play date with my 4 year old & a mommy from his school plus of course her 4 year old.  We took the kids to the park & figured hey lets go eat at Chili's. Thank god for those kids eat free coupon. LOL The hostess was so sweet I loved her to pieced & not just because she fell in love with my son & kept telling me how adorable he is but because she was a sweet heart.  One of the kids dropped their milk all over the floor & she was more than happy to clean it up.  She didn't even make a face. Our waiter looked like he was annoyed with the fact that we were sitting at the bar area with 2 toddlers. Yes I know it looks horrible but hey mommy's are entitled to at least one drink. I ordered the Tropical Margarita, yummy, I am glad it was only one because I was starting to feel a little happy.  The other mommy suggested we order the Artichoke dip, it was ok, yes just ok, I've had better.  We then ordered the Buffalo Salad, yummy this thing was delicious.   Overall good experience & we survived.

I called customer service (the corporate line) and they were awesome and helped me out and fixed the issue. Good Job Chilis :)  I will definitely be going back. I like this restaurant in west hills better than any of the others in LA, its much cleaner.

This isn't some French restaurant on the Seine. That will be abundantly evident by the long wait time. Then again, the French are not exactly expeditious, but at least they'll slap a glass of wine red atcha. Had the 7 buck lunch special (salad + mac/cheese). The mac and cheese was rather flavorful, but the serving size was measly.  Warning: lunch specials are mainly burgers, pizzas, and, well mac. Now about that wait...

A group of friends and I went there last night, and overall we had a good experience. We got seated right away, drinks were brought to us quickly - with refills. The place was clean, and our waitress was nice enough. I shared their Triple Dipper platter with my boyfriend. It's an appetizer where you get to pick any three of the choices offered. We had the Southwestern egg rolls, Boneless Buffalo Wings, and Honey-Chipotle Chicken Crispers. The egg rolls were a bit spicy, but really flavorful; the wings were good; and the chicken crispers were ok. I didn't care for the honey-chipotle sauce, it was almost as if they didn't mix it enough because some bites would be only honey flavor, and other bites would be only chipotle flavor. Maybe the original would've tasted better. I asked for extra sides of ranch for the table, which we got, but one of them was blue cheese. Personally, I HATE blue cheese so it came as quite the unpleasant surprise when I dipped my egg roll into it and started chewing. Anybody could make that mistake since they both look alike, but still you don't pay to have your order be incorrect. We had a good time, and might go back there again soon.

I'm a big fan of that 2 for $20 deal. I always pick the steak. Love all the sides it comes with. I usually go for the cheese fries as the appetizer. My coworker and I were the first customers for the day. We were on our lunch break and said so to the server who was very accommodating. We were ready with our orders and served quickly. She was great with the take-out and leftovers too...things had to be split up in a certain way. I'd definitely want to come back to this location.

I went there for my birthday :) they have really slow service we waited for so long to get the food. But I have my friends who kept chatting the whole time and that made the experience a very good one.  if you are super hungry and you can't wait for your food do not go there.  find another restaurant better for your stomach :P the food was normal (not good and not bad) 3 stars is fair deal :)

I'm not happy because they served me brown avocados which is a huge mistake. When I showed the waiter the avocados,  I asked for a side of new ones, and he had the nerve to charge me for it!!!! Where is your common sense West Hills Chili's? Come on! Also, no one greeted us when we arrived. We seated ourselves. Why didn't someone cover the front? Again, no common sense!

Ick. Remind me why I go here again? First off let me preface this by saying it's hard to find restaurants that don't side eye you for bringing a baby inside. Chili's is loud and full of kids so tonight when we wanted dinner in a pinch, we came here. I've been here several times before and never have a good experience. I always order take out and it's never ready on time. And several times I've seen other customers pissed off that it's taking long and usually their orders are wrong. Tonight, we ordered an appetizer and two entrees. My husband got tilapia and corn, and I got ribs and fries (he eats like a girl). Everything was COVERED in pepper. It's like their food is so bland they need to mask the flavor with pepper. Yuck. We barely got through dinner and left with burning pepper mouths. I've never had the "pepper experience" in the past so not sure what was with the cook tonight.

I came in this Chilis with my girlfriend a week or so ago.. we were seated right away and given menus by the hostess. We sat for at least 15 minutes before getting up and leaving. No one came by to say "Be right with you" or offer us drinks. All of the employees were standing under the TV socializing and even looked over towards us but still no one offered to get us drinks while we were waiting for the server. We asked the hostess to get the server over to our table. We watched as she told the server we needed help, and the server was cleaning a table and continued to do so then go to the back. Never showed up after a few minutes so we left. Horrible service!!

It's Chili's, so you pretty much know what you're in for when you go. This Chili's is an ok place to grab a drink or a snack in the bar area and watch the end of whatever game is on.  The large (22oz, I think) draft beers are about 4 bucks, although I think something might be wrong with the tap. I don't want super carbonated beer was super flat and lifeless. It was very cold, which I like, although I know beer purists will disagree. Appetizer samplers are a decent way to go.  And, I found it ironic that in all these years, I have never tried the chili at Chili's.  It was actually pretty good.  It tasted slow-cooked and had nice chunks of beef.  It was served with too much cheese, for me anyway, and with onions and jalapenos on the side. No gourmet meal, but a cheap and relatively satisfying way to fill your tummy.

Food and service okay. Bathroom was nasty, especially considering they just opened. The staff was very prompt and friendly as well. As for the food it wasn't bad but it wasn't stellar. I think Chili's has always had mediocre food though so nothing new there. Nice job on the rebranding though. It's just too bad the pride reflected outside wasn't reflected in the men's room.

Our server greated us with a smile and had my cold beer to me within 2 minutes from the time I ordered it.  Loved the Southwest Eggrolls and ribeye steak. TVs all over the place do I could watch the name while I ate.

They were super cool accommodating our bat shit crazy family. When we left it looked like a freakin tsunami of French fries and cheese it's hit our table, two babies, 5 alcoholics, our perverted neighbor, and our 91 year old racist grandma, Good Times!
Adding this to the list of my notable LA Chili's locations. :)

We went on Saturday night and we had the worst service ever. It was very slow slow service. Then I ordered a grilled chicken flatbread, and it came out completely burned! The waiter then told me that my new flatbread would be coming out, but after 45 minutes I still didn't have it. The manager then proceeded to tell me that they burned the second one also! Then my flatbread finally came out, it was still a tad bit burnt but at least it wasn't like it was the first time. The waiter though, tried to tell me that a flatbreads supposed to be on the crispy side. Are you kidding me right now? I've had plenty of flat Breads and I know how they're supposed to look! It's a pizza for god sakes, burnt is burnt! Then we had to ask for it to be taken off our bill, which should have been a no-brainer in the first place! It's never a fun experience when one person doesn't have their food for the entire meal. My friends had to wait an hour, sitting there, for me to get my food. Awful!!!!!
The only thing worth ordering here are the ribs. Everything else is sub par. Avoid unless you want decent ribs (yes, even the fries are sub-standard) :-(

Service is always good here. They changed their lay out for the better of larger parties. The food is always  tasty we like to order their 2 for $20 or 2 for $35 if you want margaritas and desert. Sunrise margarita is the best!!!

this chilies is located in the fallbrook shopping center its towards the northside, its a quick and good place if you want to grab a quick drink or food before movies at amc and you have some time to kill, its relatively small compared to other chillies i've been too and staff is nice

Ask Why it is that most Chili's have high ratings, and this location does not... general shoddy kitchen management here (which only comes from poor quality upper  management) 1) Look at their fajitas. We've ordered twice in the past couple of months hoping to give a second chance. They don't even bother to GRILL their sizzling "grilled chicken" fajitas... just bland, yellow, no seasoning, microwaved looking & tasting. And, they certainly dont sizzle. Hello? What management decides to screw up one of their top sellers to save... on what... time? Pay extra for steak & chicken combo fajitas only to get a ridiculously tiny portion of both...just pre-sautee'd green peppers & onions--no red peppers,  and the first time, there were even barely any of those... no fresh "sizzling in the pan" vegies here.  Chicken tortilla Soup: barely a couple pieces of chicken. At Other locations it's filled with chicken. Margaritas: barely any alcohol, all sugar syrup. I have to request that they squeeze some real lime. I could go on. Too bad, because I love Chili's.  Come on Fallbrook Ctr Chili's... pick up your quality. People are nice enough, and I've never seen it dirty, but they need to be doing better on food.

I came here for dinner with a buddy for his birthday on Friday. Our waitress was nice, helpful and friendly.  We went with the two for twenty deal. 1 appetizer, 2 entrees for 20 bucks. My friend got the bacon burger, and I went with the Cajun chicken pasta.   He seemed to enjoy his burger, and I enjoyed my Cajun chicken pasta. It was tangy enough, but not overly spicy. I enjoyed it alot. Over the course of the meal, I notified our waitress that it was his birthday, and  they should send over people to sing and embarrass him. My buddy complained and said he didn't need any singing. the waitress left.  Soon, the waitress came over with a brownie sundae sans co-workers to sing to him; she explained that she couldn't find anyone to sing. Very tactful. Good job. My food was great, the waitress was great. Good job  And on top of that, the meal was only about thirty dollars with tip and tax.  I'll definitely be back to Chili's.

Went to have dinner.  Ordered the 2 for $20 sirloin steak dinner with mashed potatoes, brocoli and garlic toast.  The dinner itself was very good.  Steak was cooked as I ordered it, medium well and my boyfriend ordered well done.  The toast came burnt.  I ordered 2 fresh pieces and told the server that the ones they brought were burnt and clearly charred.  This server which wasn't our server brought 2 more garlic toasts and again they came out burnt....so at this point...I gave up on the toast....didn't need the calories anyway...but thats beside the point.  We waited for Robert our server to come around because we needed extra napkins.  Half way into our dinner, our server Robert came and asked if we wanted desert, dropped the check and walked away.   We were still eating our meal.....maybe giving us a hint, was leaving for the evening???  We continued eating our meals and then we needed refills.  For the next 20 mins our server did not come around to check to see if we needed anything.  By the time we finished eating our meal, 20-30 minutes later.. he (Robert) came around to pu the check and asked if we needed anything.  We had been done and were ready to go.  So....bottom line is that the food was good besides the burnt toast.  The service was not so good.....Robert needs to brush up......didn't leave him a very good tip, but he got what I felt he deserved.

For a while, this the place we went on bike nite.  I'm not sure why cuz there are tons of other good rest in the area.  Anywhoo, we usually get good service anywhere we go when we roll in with our helmets and gear.  The service is decent.  The food is decent.  Nothing to write to ya momma about.  The new monster double cheese burger is good if your into meat.  They even serve sliders now, care of White Castle.  I didn't order these.  My friends said they were good.  Best thing to get thats always consistent is their combo appetizer.  Shanghai wings, artichoke dip and chips are the best.  Personally I ordered the 1/2 turkey and fries with side salad combo for $6.  I got a ceasar salad which was good sized.  Don't come here on wkends tho.  There are way too many ppl.

The molten chocolate cake is a must to have at chili's and that's just what we ordered when we sat at the bar. First of all, I have to say I was a little surprised at how empty the place was for a Friday night. My cake melted in a matter of minutes but the black russian I ordered was just right. This restaurant deserves 3 stars because the bartender was trying hard enough to be friendly even to the point of butting into our conversation.

Service was great! The food was HORRIBLE! I ordered a kids pizza meal, the pizza tasted sour and disgusting when I confronted the waiter he removed the meal and refunded the money! To make long story short my two kids, husband, and I had stomach problems for a little over 24hours! I've called to speak to the manager for two days straight and I still haven't received a call back!

I had been there about two previous times even though I live nearby but now it's three strikes and out. Very sweet waitress but it took about an hour and a half to get service for our party of ten. Food is nothing to rave about. Our group just went to hang out. Not happening again. By the way, I had the 1/2 order of  ribs and they were average. They did discount the meal for their ineptitude but too long a wait, again!
We stopped in here for a mid Black Friday day drink. The service was pretty slow and casual. I cant really write a full review since we didn't eat anything but the drink were made well.

Awful service... all the waiters were too busy fawning over a booth with two young ladies and they simply went through the motions with their other tables.  I had to get up and get cutlery and napkins for us, and it took well over 20 minutes before our order was even taken.  I've watched the service go down consistently and every time I say I will give them one more chance.  But this is it.  Not going back to this one.
This is the place to get a couple drinks and some appetizers. Food ok. Service is fast and friendly. They have tv's to watch a game or something but that's about it. Bar area is a little small.
Servers are nice, but service is slow here.  Food is good though.  This is a place from my childhood.

I would give this place a "0" star, but Yelp doesn't let me.  I'll just add to the list or horrible reviews for this ill-fated restaurant. I have never had a worse experience with customer service in any restaurant than at the Chili's at West Hills.  I went in on a wednesday night and ordered the $20 meal for 2.  Our server seemed somewhat friendly, but was very pushy about ordering drinks.  During our entire meal, only once did he, server "Wood", ever come by and offer to refill our drinks.  It was nearly 10pm by this time and there were almost no more customers.  I mean, who else could he be waiting on?  A table across from us left and there were only 2-3 tables now.  I noticed another server had picked up Wood's tip and brought it to the back.  When Wood came back, he was confused and thought the patrons had left without paying.  Puzzled and frantic, he went to speak with the other waiters to find out that another employee had already finalized their bill.  I never had a good vibe with Wood.  At the get go, there was something peculiar about his actions.  At the end of my meal, I paid him a fair tip for his more than lack luster service.  I felt that I was generous, but he obvious didn't.  I never ever check my receipts at the end of the day or week to find out if the posted tip on my credit card matches what I wrote for the waiter.  But something about our server Wood made me think differently.  The next night, I checked the posted amount and lo and behold, the TOTAL AMOUNT DUE was NOT THE SAME.  He changed my tip and deceitfully added an EXTRA $10 for himself.  I wasn't all that surprised because of his interactions with me and the other customers.  I just didn't trust him. Side:  I couldn't figure out why the server WOOD would dare to cheat someone and add a $10 TIP to a $20 meal?  Have some common sense.  Obviously, my total amount would be around $25, not $35.   I called the manager, Chris, and reported the problem.   He said he would call back.  Chris never called me back.  Strike 1.  I called and he told me that "Well, he kinda put a "1" in front of your tip.  You can tell he changed it, and also changed your total amount."   I asked: "What are you going to do about it?" Manager: "Well, we can give you $10 credit or $10 coupon.  Which option would you like?" Me: I was thinking are you serious.  Why would I ever want to come back to Chili's again.  Did you even have to give me an option.  I might as well give you my bank account number.  And seriously, just $10 credit for the all crap you put me through?!?  STRIKE 2. Me: "I'll just take the $10 credit."  Trying to hide my frustration.       "What are you guys going to do with the server?" Manager:  Oh, well, we.. uhm.. we have to look into it. Me (Thinking): Look into what! You already told me that your CROOK server changed my tip amount.  That is ILLEGAL.  It is a CRIME.  6 days later: I patiently waited for a credit back to my card.  However, I never received one.  I called Chili's and spoke with Chris and he informed me that he needed my credit card # to process the refund through accounting.  Well why didn't he tell me 6 days ago!!  I have to personal call just to get my money back.  This is ridiculous.   I asked for cash instead, and he responds, "Well, I can't, I have to ask my general manager, and he doesn't come in until tomorrow."  Then take the darn initiative to call him. He abruptly hangs up before I do.  They lack even simple customer service.  STRIKE 3!   I know these managers could care less about their jobs.  To them, it's EXACTLY that: JUST A JOB to make ends meet.  If they truly cared about their job, I wouldn't have to waste my time.  All the time spent typing this review and getting my money back won't be in VAIN if all of you Chili's patrons don't ever visit their restaurant AGAIN!   If you want to keep your money, then stay away.  If you feel like donating your hard earned money to despicable and conniving servers, then visit this Chili's at your discretion.  But you've been WARNED!
this branch is the best one you can find in the valley..food is good as well as the staff..bring me thw fajita trio.

Started off on wrong foot as I had called ahead and gave my name to hostess (cause it's was getting late on a Sat) but, when I got there the hostess told me I hadn't called...so I pulled out the iPhone and hit redial and was connected to said hostess and I re introduced my self to her, she walked away obviously embarrassed...what makes me mad is there was no "hey sorry about that" or anything...that annoys me...will Finnish review after dinner...... Ok service totally sucked...the waiter never brought out my dinner salad and later almost after my dinner had the balls to ask If I still wanted it!!! Told him no and as we got the check the wife had me check and sure enough the salad was not taken off...just lazy. On to the food...I used to get the ribs here until the quality went way downhill a few years ago...so now I order triple dipper for dinner cause the southwest eggrolls are really good, get it with boneless wings and chicken crispers, the crispers were filled with grease and soggy...nasty best thing about meal was when we left and made a family pact not to ever return to this west hills location EVER again!!!!!

This place is down the street from my house and I've been coming here for years. I was solo this time (like a chump) so I sat in the bar area where it's self seating. My table and menu were a little dirty, but it Chillis so I wasnt expecting anything more. The chick serving was very prompt and polite. I ordered the ribeye medium rare, which came out very good minus a little bit of gristle. Also, I don't know how or why, but Chillis has the greatest mashed potatoes every. It comes with the whacky black pepper gravy that would taste good on my shoe. Altogether, pretty decent steak and beer for sub $30.

My roommate eat here at least twice a week. The service is good and friendly. The food is mostly fried but the steak, shrimp and chicken trio is AWESOME! I also enjoy the fresh salmon and shrimp combo with loaded mashed potato's. And I like to end the meal with a nice piece of cheese cake. If you drink there is a full bar for those to enjoy more than just a glass of wine.

after 5 minutes of waiting, we left! no service at all! this place has horrible service. sat in a loud corner near a big party of people, didn"t even get drinks. or anything. i was giving this place 1 more chance after 1 year ago when the manager quickly left burn food in front of me and i had to chase her down as she ignored me calling her from right behind. and then served us burned food again. what can i say i give up. we have no good chili's restaurants in the san fernando valley! this suck!
When my friends and I gather at Chili's we start with thirst quenching drinks and tasty appetizers!  Then sharing a couple of entrees and we are set for the night!
Love the Mini Burgers! We get Take-Out here a lot. Usually the service is top notch, but every now and then they forget something. The food is always good though :)

Despite a lot of negative reviews about this particular Chili's, my experiences have been pretty good.  My food has consistently been cooked to order, waiting to be served was never too long, and the waiters/waitresses have always been kind and helpful.

a couple of my friends throughout the years have raved to me about chili's burgers. how good they are, how big they are and how i "really need to try it." i avoided it like the plague since i generally know how these kind of burgers are. so while seeing a friend in woodland hills, she decided that we should go to chili's and i obliged.  i think we went on a friday or saturday night because it was packed! not surprising though, all these chain places fill up on weekends. we had to wait about 20 minutes for a table, again pretty normal.  finally seated, i know i want a burger. i decide on chipotle bleu cheese bacon burger. sounds good right? i beg the server to have it cooked less than medium, no go. my friend gets a steakie thing. food comes out pretty quick and i dive into my burger. oh god not again! another dry, bland, not juicy, not seasoned, over cooked, over priced burger. the only saving grace was the bacon was excellent and the burger was a little greasy, that helped make up for the lack of quality burger juice. and size wise, i was expecting a much larger patty for something dubbed "big mouth burger" but no, just a thin little burger king patty.  i always knew my "friends" that loved chili's were idiots, but now it's official. at least i don't have to go there ever again.

Chilis is a go to place in a pinch always know what you will get.  The burgers are big and tasty and for a chain the Mephis dry rub ribs are very good.  Also the kids menu has a good variety of choices.

After thousands of years in a vacuum, Chili's has started making broad strokes in revising their menu.  If you haven't been recently, the smokehouse burgers are a new addition that was surprisingly good.  I got the jalapeo version and it was delicious.  Another new dish that I liked was the buffalo chicken fajita.   Be aware, though, that something about Chili's alters people's interactions.  You'll remember from the Office that Michael Scott makes some of his best sales deals are brokered at Chili's.  Well, in my experience, the truth comes out at Chili's.  So, if you're trying to avoid telling your girl she needs to lose some weight, avoid Chili's; it's like sodium penathol.

Chili's in general are starting to up their game. The menus have better choices of food and actually seem to taste better. I dined at this location recently and it was pretty decent. It was a week night, so it wasn't too busy, which means good and speedy service. The food was pretty good, no complaints there. Reason I gave it 4 stars and not five is that I had to keeping reminding my waitress of certain things, she was pretty forgetful. but other then that she was cool.

Food's alright, I guess. Edible. But what really irks me about this place is how I never get seated. I've come to this location maybe three times in the past year and a half, and each of those times, the seater just refused to seat me. I have no idea why. One time, the excuse was that the hostess forgot to write my name. And another time, the hostess forgot that we were waiting. And the last time, we made sure that the hostess wrote our name, and I went up to make sure that she knew we were waiting...and she still sat three parties that came in after us before us. And these three parties were the same size as ours.... I have no idea??!! I swear I'm not on the FBI 10 Most Wanted. And I swear I've never done anything horrible to anybody here. I've never had some massive diva-fit. So I dunno....I hate it when people play the race card, but this place is starting to make me feel paranoid about being asian? hmm. interesting.
